title: System Development Engineer II, Enterprise Engineering
description:
Job Title: System Development Engineer
Position Type: Full-Time
Position Overview:
As a System Development Engineer II at our company, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing complex enterprise systems for our clients. You will work closely with our team of experienced engineers to provide innovative solutions and support our clients' overall IT strategy. This is a highly technical role that requires expertise in various technologies and the ability to think strategically and troubleshoot effectively.
Key Responsibilities:
- Collaborate with clients and internal teams to identify system requirements and objectives
- Design and implement enterprise systems that meet client needs and align with company standards and best practices
- Serve as a subject matter expert on the latest technologies and industry trends, and make recommendations for improvement and optimization
- Develop detailed technical specifications, diagrams, and documentation for system solutions
- Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues related to enterprise systems and applications
- Perform regular maintenance and updates to ensure the stability and security of systems
- Communicate project status, issues, and potential risks to stakeholders and provide recommendations for resolution
- Mentor junior engineers and share knowledge and best practices with the team
- Identify opportunities for process improvement and automation to increase efficiency and reduce costs
- Stay up-to-date on relevant technology advancements and integrate them into our systems and processes as appropriate
Qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
- Minimum of 3 years of experience in enterprise system development and implementation
- Strong knowledge of various programming languages and technologies, such as Java, C , Python, and JavaScript
- Experience with cloud platforms, such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud
- Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to troubleshoot complex technical issues
- Knowledge of networking protocols and security principles
- Strong communication and interpersonal skills to work effectively with clients and team members
- Ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
- Willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies and methodologies
- Previous experience in a leadership or mentorship role is a plus
At our company, we value diversity and are committed to equal opportunities and creating an inclusive work environment. We offer competitive salaries, comprehensive benefits, and opportunities for professional growth and development.
If you are a self-motivated and passionate engineer with a strong background in enterprise system development, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to join our dynamic and innovative team.

title: Human Resource Generalist -Exempt $50K -$55K
description:
Description:
This is a responsible position performing work in the areas of screening, interviewing and orientation of new employees, internal and external job postings, assisting with benefit administration, recruitment/retention, entering data and maintaining Human Resource information system, employee relations and services, personnel records, formalizing of policies and procedures along with the tracking of employee development and orientation. This position requires confidentiality regarding correspondence and files, self-initiative, independent thinking, motivation, out-going personality, positive public relations and a need for accuracy in work. 
EXAMPLES OF WORK DUTIES:
 (Any one position may not include all the following nor do all the listed examples include all duties and responsibilities which may be required of the position).
1. Assist HR Director with the total operation of the Human Resources office, including Payroll, EEOC compliance and Workers compensation reporting (OSHA 300 annual report).
2. Full scale recruitment including but not limited to: application screening, assessing candidates skills, interviewing, Creation of Conditional Job offers for employment, onboarding and conducting new employee orientation.
3. External Recruitment/Establishing partnerships and maintaining positive relationships with colleges, churches, Civic groups, and training institutes. This includes but not limited to, maintaining positive communication, expanding customer base, branding, meetings, presentations, research, analyze data, dispatch informational fliers/emails, transportation, and Job Fairs to increase community awareness and establish a pipeline to employment.
4. Attracting suitable candidates through online employment forums, social media, etc.
5. Processing all applications, reference checks and criminal records checks in a timely fashion for employees, volunteer, service learning students, and Encircle.
6. Maintain skills to operate the computer data base system of Human Resources Office.
7. Assist with disciplinary issues and employee/management coaching, as needed or advised. Assist company Managers on HR issues.
8. Assist with Annual Outcomes Report
9. Conduct annual Family Care Safety Registry background reports and monitoring.
10. Weekly updates/monitoring of vacancy list
11. Ability to work with a diverse work force.
12. Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills.
13. Working knowledge of current employment laws.
14. Computer proficiency.
15. Good organizational and time management skills.
16. Ability to maintain confidentiality.
17. Ability to work as a productive team player.
18. Act in a professional, courteous manner.
19. Assist with updating and revision of training curriculum.
20. Serve as an instructor for presenting new employee orientation.
21. May be required to perform additional duties not specifically listed or implied here as situations arise or as assigned by the HR Manager or Leadership personnel.
22. Assist with completion of Annual Consumer Satisfaction and employee Satisfaction Surveys.
23. Chairperson for the Recruitment Committee. Assist/Facilitate Employee Recognition and culture events. Participate in Employee Relations Committee
Requirements:
ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS: This generalist position requires a Bachelor's Degree in Human Services or 5 years of experience in the Human Resource field.
ESSENTIAL PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: This is sedentary work requiring the exertion of up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to move objects; work requires fingering, grasping, and repetitive motions; vocal communication is required for expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word; hearing is required to perceive information at normal spoken word levels; visual acuity is required for preparing and analyzing written or computer data, operation of machines, determining the accuracy and thoroughness of work, and observing general surroundings and activities; the worker is not subject to adverse environmental conditions.
Must be at least 18 years old
Must have at least a high school diploma
Mandatory drug screen 
Mandatory criminal background checks

title: Market Analyst
description:
Why CCI? 
CCI Systems, Inc. is an Employee-Owned solution provider specializing in telecommunications, comprehensive network assessments, industry-leading engineering, drafting and design services, and 24/7 support services. Come join our team of engineers and experts that guide our customers toward the right choices to future-proof their network for years to come. Our outstanding team-based work culture and environment has allowed us to grow, develop, and retain long-term employees. We value our employee’s hard work and determination and 
REWARD
 results all while having fun! 
Our mission
 is to make life better by connecting people through innovative communication systems.
We are seeking 
a
 
Market Analyst
 to lead market research efforts, prepare market analysis material, follow, and monitor industry trends, and provide actionable market data/information to the necessary stakeholders. The market analyst will also create content for CCI’s website and for industry events on an as needed basis. 
Responsibilities
- Develop and maintain deep understanding of telecom and broadband industry – trends, funding sources, timelines, RFPs, associated locations, etc.
- In the future, there are plans to expand and develop knowledge base to encompass parallel industries, including but not limited to electric/power and others, as the need arises.
- Lead market research, prepare material and relay actionable market data/information to the necessary stakeholders regularly.
- Document federal and state government funding programs such as RDOF and BEAD including amounts, timing, and recipients as well as other key updates and strategies associated.
- Document evaluation of pricing models, forecast demand for new and existing services, and help identify areas of potential growth.
- Document evaluation of potential demand for new and future service offerings.
- Document evaluation of competitive landscape including mergers, acquisitions, investments, new entrants, large project announcements, major leadership changes, etc.
- Document evaluation of what customers value and consumption models.
- Document evaluation of demographics and create target consumer profiles.
- Assist with the creation and implementation of process development and improvement plans as it relates to data mining, analysis, and creating actionable data.
- Prepare market data reports utilizing data from a variety of internal and external resources.
- Provide actionable data to the necessary stakeholders and assist in managing timelines and process to turn this data into opportunities for CCI Systems.
- Join RFP sites and mine for relevant opportunities.
- Participate in focus groups, meetings, and agendas as it relates to the position. 
- Ensure confidentiality of company and customer information.
- Assist in the research and development for marketing related tasks as necessary.
- Other duties as assigned by manager.
 
Qualifications
- Bachelor’s degree in market analysis or closely related field.
- 2+ years of experience with market data analysis is required.
- 3+ years of experience with market data analysis within telecommunications and/or similar industries is preferred.
- Excellent computer skills, including proficiency in all Microsoft Office products.
- Familiar with tools such as Google Alerts, HubSpot, ZoomInfo, 6Sense, DemandBase, Euromonitor, Gartner, Factiva, Pitchbook, CapIQ, Refinitiv Workspace, Kompyte, Crayon, FactSet, Brandwatch, Ariba Discovery, GovWin, BidSync, Public RFP, BoardDocs, BroadbandUSA, RFP Central, Adobe Acrobat, Zoom, and other similar software.
- Understanding of request for proposal (RFP) websites, social media networks, and blog platforms is preferred.
- Demonstrate a genuine passion for your work, maintain a positive outlook, and exhibit self-motivation and drive in your endeavors.
- Demonstrate the capability to proactively seek and uncover elusive data, including identifying potential decision-makers through effective research.
- Possess a strong analytical mindset with the capability to review and comprehend research data effectively.
- Proficient in problem-solving and critical thinking, with the ability to analyze situations, evaluate information, and devise effective solutions.
- Demonstrates the ability to meet deadlines and/or targets, thriving in high-pressure or stressful situations.
- Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills - ability to actively listen and clearly communicate.
- Possesses strong organizational skills encompassing scheduling, planning, process review, and the meticulous documentation of detailed notes and reports.
- Ability to work independently, collaborate with team, and maintain professional demeanor.
- The ability to embrace corporate values, understands the company mission, and exemplifies CCI behaviors.
Shift 
is
 
full-time, Monday-Friday between the hours of 8:00 am – 5:00 pm CST. Must be flexible and willing to work outside normal business hours as necessary.

title: Business Account Coordinator
description:
Description:
Hours: Full-Time
As the Business Account Coordinator, you will play a vital role in ensuring quality service by assisting Socket's business customers with questions and routing customer inquiries. You will utilize your communication and management skills through work with an array of Socket customers.
Position Responsibilities:
- Answering and directing all business client phone calls.
- Interacting with Business Center Analysts, Network Operations, Account Executives and other departments where necessary to insure customer issues are resolved in a timely manner.
- Acting as a backup to the Business Center Analyst in-bound phone queue.

- Filing documents for new and current customers. Maintaining the filing system both in the file cabinet and on the file server.
- Contacting various Telcos with problems or questions regarding ADSL service orders, either through direct contact or via submission of trouble tickets.
- Performing all cancellation of ADSL service by placing orders with the various ILECs for residential and business customers, updating changes in customer status and documenting cancellations in the appropriate interfaces.
- Placing Change of Responsibility (COR) and POTS orders/transfers with the various ILECs.
Requirements:
- Associate’s Degree and/or equivalent work experience in the Telecommunications/Internet field is preferred. 
- Candidates must possess excellent customer service skills, a positive & professional attitude, and a desire to succeed. 
- Must have the ability to multitask, work with little supervision and as a team.

title: Service Delivery Coordinator
description:
Description:
Individuals in this role work closely with the sales team and the sales engineer(s), as well as Network Operations, to ensure that the customer’s expectations towards actualization of services are met.
Duties and responsibilities fall into the 4 main categories of Customer Facing; System Interaction and Order Management; Vendor Management; and Accountability.
Customer Facing 
- Single Point of Contact – Manages, plans and directs the overall order and service related activities for the company’s customer service function to ensure all expectations and intervals are met. 
- Sets the customers’ expectations and establishes timelines in regards to milestones and installation of services. 
- Handles all customer questions, concerns and escalations. 
- Provides Firm Order Commitments on each order for customer to manage our interval progress. Owns relationship building with the customer. 
- Works with customers to meet Service Level Agreements (SLAs). 
System Interaction - Order Management 
- Implementation of the appropriate provisioning plans. 
- Information management & document issuance – including Data Integrity. 
- Establishes and maintains expectations/deadlines. 
- Ensures proper MRC and NRC are billing at circuit activation. 
- Maintains and updates documentation for standardization. 
- Manages internal resources (tangible and intangible) to meet deadlines.
Vendor Management 
- Manages escalations against vendors when dates are slipped or are in jeopardy. 
- Coordinates vendor meets and testing activities. 
- Tracks orders and provide status to staff and outside vendors/carriers. 
- Manages data integrity functions with regards to vendor information.
Accountability 
- Meeting Commitments - Responsible for on time deliverables and meeting the FOC. 
- Professional Relationships - Managing vendor and customer relationships. 
- Project Management - Keeping all timelines on track, managing internal and external projects. 
- Data Integrity - Updating all systems to reflect correct data. 
- Work Ethic - Integrity, respect, honor, personal responsibility and honesty in all dealings; internal and external to the company. 
- Development - Seeks ongoing training in service delivery trends and new service offerings. 
Requirements:
High school diploma or equivalent required. Four years related college, trade school, or two years job-related experience in customer or technical service field preferred. 
- Willingness to assume ownership and responsibility.
- Must be pro-active and very responsive to customer needs.
- Be a quick learner.
- Possess strong sense of self-motivation.
- Maintain strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
- Proven ability to work in a fast paced, time critical environment.
- Ability to interpret information.
- Excellent attention to detail.
#ZR

title: Design and Fabrication Process Engineer
description:
General Description
Under the direction of the chief engineer, this position is responsible for the design and development of products, development and improvement of fabrication department processes, and support tasks within the engineering department.
Education, Certifications, Licenses, and/or Registrations
Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering or related degree is required. Valid driver license is required.
Experience
Minimum one (1) year engineering experience is preferred. 
Specialized Knowledge and Skills
- Advanced technical knowledge and manual dexterity
- Strong grasp of engineering and design principles
- Knowledge of various types of agricultural, construction, paving, and landscaping equipment is preferred.
- Knowledge of metal fabrication technology, machining, semi-automated and automated welding, part assembly, heat treating, part finishing, metallurgy, and quality control processes
- Advanced mathematical, reading, and critical thinking skills
- Able to read micrometers, calipers, tape measure, and other measuring equipment
- Able to create, read, and interpret mechanical blueprints and engineering specifications
- Understand geometric dimensioning and tolerancing
- An awareness of the safety and environmental impact of design ideas
- Able to use hand tools, power tools, fabrication, machining, and welding equipment is preferred
- Able to follow instructions and retain information
- In-depth knowledge of CAD and CAM software
- Experience using Creo Parametric preferred
- Stress and displacement analysis skills through manual calculations or simulation software
- Strong knowledge of industry and market trends
- Working knowledge of office equipment including phones, computers, copiers, etc.
- Proficient in the use of Microsoft products
- Able to compose technical reports and procedures
- Must have strong verbal, written, oral, and interpersonal skills
- Time and project management skills
- Able to work on projects demanding fast production start-ups
- Independently determine approach to assigned tasks
- Possess a creative, logical approach for generating new ideas and solutions, with the ability to transition through to product and process development
- Highly detail oriented
- Creative thinking
- Problem solving skills
- Collaboration skills and the ability to work well with others in a team environment, providing input and feedback in a helpful manner
- Confidentiality
- Flexibility
- Multi-tasking skills
- Able to work independently
- Advanced trouble shooting skills
Essential Duties
1. Working independently or as part of team, develop, design, and test new products or update existing products.
- Design products per design requirements established by chief engineer.
- Designs shall take into consideration cost to produce, inhouse manufacturability, product safety, and environmental impact.
- Create 3D CAD models.
- Analyze designs utilizing manual calculations or simulation software to ensure proper clearances, part interactions, and structural integrity.
- Working with CAD drafter, create, and revise prototype and production drawings and prepare engineering change notices.
- Working with purchasing and vendors, specify purchase part requirements and identify potential suppliers.
- Participate in design review meetings.
- Create prototype work orders in Visual ERP system.
- Communicate with production department and shop floor concerning priority of prototype orders and pilot builds.
- Manufacture all or portions of prototype orders as necessary in order to maintain project progression or access the ease of product manufacture.
- Determine product testing procedures, direct product testers or perform product tests, and maintain records of tests and failures.
- Assist technical writer in the development of product documents.
2. Provide product related technical support to sales and customer service.
3. Provide product related support to manufacturing and quality. 
- Work with quality to resolve to issues. 
- Make decisions concerning allowable deviations to products and manufacturing processes.
4. Working with the fabrication department supervisor and tool and die, develop fabrication related manufacturing processes for new and revised products.
- Processes shall take into consideration product volume, reliability, and productivity.
- Resources required to manufacture
- Tooling and fixturing requirements
5. Working with the fabrication department supervisor, continually improve the utilization and productivity of the fabrication department.
- Review current fabrication methods and seek out improvements.
- Assist in troubleshooting of process related issues.
- Develop, evaluate, and/or source, and cost justify fabrication department machinery and equipment. 
- Work with vendors to determine equipment specifications.
- Submit recommendations to chief engineer for approval.
6. Serve as primary programmer or backup programmer for lasers, plasma, and brake press. Provide assistance when programming issues arise.
7. Create and update those areas of the Visual ERP system that are the responsibility of the engineering department.
- Part maintenance
- Engineering masters
- Outside Services
8. Follow all company and safety policies, guidelines, and rules.
9. Follow all quality standards.
- Quality is the responsibility of everyone, not just quality control.
10. Work in a fast-paced environment.
11. Stay focused and on task with minimal supervision.
12. Maintain a clean and organized work area.
13. Maintain regular and reliable attendance.
14. Perform other duties as assigned.
Work Environment
Spends half (1/2) of the time in an industrial manufacturing environment with loud noise level. Facility is enclosed, ventilated, and heated but not air conditioned. Safety-toe footwear, safety eyewear, and hearing protection required. Gloves or other PPE as needed. Spends half (1/2) time in an office environment using office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers/printers, and filing cabinets.
Physical Demands
Spends more than half (1/2) of the time standing, kneeling/crouching/stooping, using hands, and reaching. Able to lift up to 75 lbs. and occasionally position heavier material with the aid of lifting device(s). Lift and move heavy items via overhead crane and forklift. Generally requires clear vision at close distances for reading blueprints, instructions, and precision measuring instruments. Must be able to concentrate for extended periods of time. This position may require long periods of sitting or standing while using office equipment and computers.
Schedule
Full time exempt. Regular office hours Monday through Friday, 7:30 AM – 4:30 PM. Estimated between 40 and 50 work hours per week.
Travel
Some travel may be required for training.

title: Administrative Assistant - Needed To Prioritize And Organize
description:
The Administrative Assistant we need to join forces with was born of steely grit and an unmatched determination to succeed, you pull no punches. Ice runs through your veins. Direct and candid but loaded with integrity, you’re straighter than the straightest arrow. You know when to turn on the charm, but you don’t favor laggards, and you do right by the whole. The people in your circle know you’re a certified work machine. You figure things out at lightning speed, and you put your problem-solving skills into action fast. 
Your knack for following up and following through is your gift.
 The more you have going on, the better. The world goes quiet. You’re in the zone. You are a professional grade Administrative Assistant.
If you don’t have a background in the financial services sector, worry not, we’ll train the right type of get-it-done individual with relatable experience.
As our next Admin Assistant you’ll be the tip of the spear and the conduit for financial knowledge transfer between our clients and our Wealth Advisors. That means you’ll help assist in the preparation of presentations and reports for prospect and client meetings. You’ll work with our Wealth Advisors and clients to analyze, research, and implement solutions focused on client specific investment, tax, insurance, and estate planning. You’ll assist in the construction of investment plans using our financial planning tools. You’ll be expected to learn our technology stack backward and forward, including Charles Schwab’s and Raymond James' robust software platform for independent RIAs. 
Most importantly, you’ll run point to prepare, coordinate, track, execute and follow through on correspondence, compliance tasks and action plans for WR Wealth clients. Daily five star client service will always be your chief duty.
 We're also going to invest in your knowledge set — in time, you’ll have an opportunity to sit for your Certified Financial Planner exam and accreditation. That’s when you’ll prove you have what it takes to be the best of the best. Great things will follow.
Founded in 2009, WR Wealth Planners, a Registered Investment Advisor firm is small but mighty. 
Quickly approaching over a billion dollars in Assets Under Management, we are a firm on an exponential growth curve that’s blazing new trails.
 We take client responsibilities very, very seriously. Our visionary approach means having a holistic game plan for gains and unwavering commitment to accuracy and timely execution when it comes to managing our clients most important asset — their money. Our operation is equipped to service and provide solutions through the entirety of our clients financial family life cycle with discipline. 
That means our work has purpose because future generations depend on us to always do the right thing.
If learning lights your fire and you’re ready to level up your career as a Client Service guru, take a chance and apply today to be our next Administrative Assistant. We’re looking for only high performance individuals ready to go the extra mile to win. Invest your time today to apply now. 
It could be the best career decision you’ve ever made.
Position Performance Expectations
- 98% client satisfaction rate
- Maintain a 99% compliance rating year over year
- 95% on time, on budget, quality delivery of EOS rocks and workflows
- Own and master one special discipline practice area
- Sit and pass your CFP exam in under 24 months
- Professionalism, trustworthiness, punctuality, work ethic, collaborativeness
Position Overview:
- Highlights: Data-driven, high performance environment, supportive team
- Job Type: Executive Assistant, Admin Assistant, Office Manager, Wealth Associate
- Training: Formal and Informal
- Work Hours: Full Time
- Compensation: $49,000 - $61,000 annually + bonuses
- Benefits: Medical, 401k
- Location: Columbia, MO 65203
Position Requirements:
- Two years of Wealth Management or Banking experience preferred
- Two years of Administrative or relatable experience preferred
- High School Diploma or Equivalent
- High Internal Emotional Need To Succeed (HIENTS)
- Computer, phone systems, and typing proficiency
*WR Wealth Planners is an equal opportunity employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, and local law.

title: Community Living RN Exempt $66,560 -$72,800 Annually
description:
Description:
The primary responsibility of the Community Living Nurse is to assess medical needs regarding Woodhaven Individuals and respond to those needs. The Community Living Nurse works with community physicians and their nurses to maximize the effectiveness of the individuals supported care, orders, recommendations, etc. and ensures that Woodhaven staff understand those and incorporate them into the overall lifestyle of the individual served.
**$5000 Sign-On bonus will be paid in $1250 increments every 6 months. 
EXAMPLES OF JOB DUTIES/MARGINAL FUNCTIONS OF THE JOB:
1. Priority is completing face to face monthly nursing assessments in compliance with DMH guidelines and standards.
2. Review, analyze, and interpret lab results at least monthly.
3. Review Physician Orders for accuracy and staff compliance at least monthly.
4. Monthly medication reconciliation: review MAR for accuracy, compare to physician orders, note compliance, monitor side effects of medications and utilization of PRNs. Check for accurate storage, labeling, effectiveness, and supporting diagnosis for medications prescribed. Consult with MD, Pharmacist and other appropriate contacts to facilitate optimal health outcomes as related to prescribed pharmacological therapy and accuracy of MARs.
5. Monthly Health Records Review includes but is NOT limited to: Assessing vital signs, blood sugar, dietary, fluids, seizure, weight, immunization records, bowel activity, menses, skin, range of motion, event reports for falls, injuries, medication errors, medical appointments, hospitalization/ER reports, and significant changes in behavior.
6. Provide appropriate delegation and supervision of unlicensed support staff who perform such duties as medication administration and other nursing tasks when applicable and document these.
7. Complete RN Directives (recommendations for program enhancements) on each monthly assessment, whenever opportunities for service improvements are identified.
8. Timely and reimbursable documentation of monthly health assessment and separate billing note.
9. Managing assigned case load and providing support to Contract RN and other nursing colleagues to meet the Health Service needs of individuals served.
10. Become acquainted with individuals supported, staff and agency systems.
11. Provide direct nursing care when needed (catheter changes, suture removal, etc.)
12. Advise Assistant Director of Residential Services/Health Services, Director of Residential and Community Services, Program Manager and Home Coordinator of issues related to health and safety of individuals.
13. Assessment, nursing diagnosis, nursing care and counsel of persons who are ill, injured or experiencing alterations in normal health processes.
14. Share on-call responsibility within the health services department.
15. Employee in-services/training as needed.
16. Responsibility for the teaching of healthcare and prevention of illness to the individuals supported and his or her family.
17. The administration of medications and treatments as prescribed.
18. Ability to appropriately intervene with individuals who may display challenging and combative behaviors.
19. Recommends supports and services as needed.
20. Maintain confidentiality of each individual.
21. Serve as a member of HIPAA team. Assume and carry out assigned responsibilities pertaining to the protection and disclosures of private health care information (PHI).
22. Works in partnership with other area agencies for the best interest of individuals supported.
23. Monitor the application of all physician orders, including but not limited to treatments, procedures, labs, appointments, specialized diet and adaptive equipment for consumers. Applicant must ensure that physician orders are carried out or implemented based on the individual needs of the persons receiving services and in accordance with the DMH requirements.
24. Consults with Home Coordinators, Direct Support Professionals, Program Managers, Director of Residential and Community Services and personnel of other agencies, including other health care agencies emphasizing best practices in regard to our individuals.
25. The coordination and assistance in the delivery of a plan of care with all members of the health team.
26. Ensure that all services are in compliance with CARF standards and certification principles.
27. Assess employees who receive a work-related injury and refer them for appropriate medical follow up if necessary and provide the information to the Human Resource office immediately following the assessment.
STAFF ORIENTATION:
1. Visit homes and educate staff regarding healthcare issues.
2. Assist with medication classes as needed.
3. Work with Program Manager's and Home Coordinator's to resolve concerns addressed by CMRO RN's & Support Coordinators.
4. Assist with providing Healthcare Training for staff (CMA, Nutrition, choking, etc.)

ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS/FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITION:

valid Missouri Registered Nurse license
. Basic Computer skills, experience in Community Health Care or working with individuals with intellectual/developmental disabilities is preferred. Applicant must maintain a positive relationship with individuals they support. Applicant must have the ability to cooperate and work well with the individuals receiving services, their families and staff. The applicant must have a reliable personal vehicle and must be amenable to participating in the on-call rotation.
Essential Qualifications/Functions of the Position also include:
· Attendance/Ability to work flexible hours. Employees are expected to be reliable when reporting to work.

title: Technical Support Coordinator
description:
Nooter/Eriksen is seeking a 
Technical Support Coordinator
 to join the Aftermarket Team. This role is part of a team that is responsible for managing sales, maintenance and major retrofits for existing Heat Recovery Steam Generators (HRSGS) and Industrial Power Boilers. Our offices are located in Fenton, MO. The expectation is that this will be a hybrid position depending on business needs.
DAY IN THE LIFE:
The 
Technical Support Coordinator
 reports directly to the Senior Aftermarket Account Manager and will help with the day-to-day activities of the Aftermarket group to ensure that sales are maximized and that large projects are executed with minimal issues.

Technical Support Coordinator

You will also assemble EPIC Cleaning package and Spare Parts Lists and assist with generating and maintaining documentation for customer submittals, special assignments, and day-to-day work, as needed.

:
We want the person selected for this role to be successful! The following qualifications are essential to be effective in this role:
- Associate degree, or Technical or Vocational education in a related field, preferred. Equivalent work experience may be considered in lieu of education.
- Ability to read/analyze technical engineering and fabrication drawings and a general understanding of graphic design strongly preferred.
- Highly professional, organized, and trustworthy team player; Proficiency in English.
- Excellent time management, organization and communication skills are a must for this highly productive position!
- Ability to read, write, problem solve, make quick decisions, interpret data and analyze results; effective written and verbal communication is essential.

title: IT Planning Analyst / PMA_Remote
description:
MatchPoint Solutions is a fast-growing, young, energetic global IT-Engineering services company with clients across the US. We provide technology solutions to various clients like Uber, Robinhood, Netflix, Airbnb, Google, Sephora, and more! More recently, we have expanded to working internationally in Canada, China, Ireland, UK, Brazil, and India. Through our culture of innovation, we inspire, build, and deliver business results, from idea to outcome. We keep our clients on the cutting edge of the latest technologies and provide solutions by using industry-specific best practices and expertise.
We are excited to be continuously expanding our team. If you are interested in this position, please send over your updated resume. We look forward to hearing from you!
Job Title: IT Planning Analyst / PMA
Location: Remote - Prefer SF Bay Area or PST. Candidates MUST work PST
Duration: 6+ Months
Pay rate:$40-$45/hr on w2
Job Responsibilities:
Financials:
-Perform timecard validation (weekly)
-Reconcile actuals to forecast (PowerBI) on a weekly basis. Follow up where necessary
-Run actuals to forecast during month end
-Capture and make adjustments to forecast sheets
Vendor Management:
-Perform monthly control processes to ensure all contract resources accounted for and allocated to full capacity
-Run monthly report for resource managers to validate
-Make adjustments per requests from resource managers
Product Support:
-Run monthly operative dates from Planisware and send to PO's. Action items that need attention
-Run deliverable report out of Planisware and work with PO's to complete deliverable coming due including upload to Planisware, get approvals and close out
- Assist with the daily contract operations and provide general IT business & planning support.
- Prepare reports through gathering, analyzing, and summarizing data and information; prepares presentation materials for management reports.
- Originates contracts in the PG&E procurement system, ARIBA and enter contract financial liabilities into the contract management ATRIUM tool.
- Assist in the initiation, conducting and coordinating of contract renewal analysis for IT operations, financial reviews; and analyzing multi-year contract to ensure that costs are planned in the most efficient manner.
- Maintain annual Operational Expense budgets utilizing proper accounting/budgeting controls, enter financial data into tracking system, and compile regular and ad-hoc financial status reports.
- Monitor Purchase Orders, review contract invoices, accruals, identify disparities, and resolve issues with the vendors.
- Analyzes actual spend and forecasting to determine if/when appropriate change controls and escalation reporting to leadership.
- Provides financial analysis on portfolio cost variances for plan vs. actual and can identify inappropriate charges by resources or vendors and makes appropriate corrections in SAP.
- Leads meetings and acts as a liaison among stakeholders to coordinate, document, and schedule changes to IT contracts.
- Capture, analyze and present data to managers and directors to aid in making business decisions.
- Effectively plans and control scope of work on contract renewals; integrates all aspects, tracks and ensures that contracts origination targets are on schedule and meets the required standard.
- Develops communications needed to summarize analysis and to discuss recommendations for IT management. This may take the form of dashboards, power point decks, or summarized emails.
- Facilitates problems solving sessions and workshops with diverse set of business and technology team members.
- Proactively follows-up on issues and initiatives for senior leaders to ensure successful resolution and implementation.
- Works closely with leaders and other key stakeholders to ensure that key initiatives and activities are delivered in a timely and coordinated manner that is aligned with the goals of the organization.
- Works with the data management team to build new tools and assist with creation and migration of reports to Power BI.
- Experience with downloading and extracting data from SAP into meaningful business intelligence reports and dashboards.
- Works with IT and functional leadership to establish a variety of key business, financial and performance metrics. Qualifications:
Minimum
:
- BA/BS in Computer Science, Business, or job-related discipline or equivalent experience
- 4 years of general business experience Desired:
- Proficient in Microsoft Office, Visio, PowerPoint, and expert level Excel skills
- Experience with structuring contract agreements
- Experience with basic financial modeling or data management
- Experience with presenting to leadership and developing power point slides.
- Experience with Power BI a plus

title: Utility Business Analyst_Remote
description:
MatchPoint Solutions is a fast-growing, young, energetic global IT-Engineering services company with clients across the US. We provide technology solutions to various clients like Uber, Robinhood, Netflix, Airbnb, Google, Sephora, and more! More recently, we have expanded to working internationally in Canada, China, Ireland, UK, Brazil, and India. Through our culture of innovation, we inspire, build, and deliver business results, from idea to outcome. We keep our clients on the cutting edge of the latest technologies and provide solutions by using industry-specific best practices and expertise.
We are excited to be continuously expanding our team. If you are interested in this position, please send over your updated resume. We look forward to hearing from you!
Role: Utility Business Analyst
Location: Remote PST hours preferred
Duration: 12 months- likely to extend
Pay rate:$50-$60/hr on w2
REQUIRED:
- BIGGEST MUST HAVE: understand the ADMS/SCADA/EMS/ System Protection Data
- MUST have power systems experience (examples are coupling and decoupling)
- they must understand the functions of the Ops
- understand how the outage happens
- understand what is the impact of the load on Transmission line- load balancing
- Should be very experience in Utility Control center /Grid control center NICE TO HAVE:
- smart meter data, SCADA telemetry data, outage data, SAP Notification data, SAP asset data, SAP order data, system protection data, system automation data, field work data(needs to be able to pull data from all these platforms and understand how they operate)
- GIS Data is a plus also
Position details:
The Sr. Utility Business Analyst will be developing a career for himself/herself filled with excitement! The utility industry is in the middle of a massive transformation. Energy generation is going from 100% centralized to significantly distributed. Operational decision-making and control actions are going from largely manual to largely automated. Technologies such as energy storage, electric vehicle, autonomous vehicle, robots, drones and machine learning are either already changing or are poised to change the way electric utilities operate. Sophisticated analytics are at the heart of all these changes. This role will be responsible for the following activities.
- Show the stakeholders the data and analytics capabilities of the team
- Come up with ideas for new analytics
- Capture product requirements in work management tools such as Jira
- Build Power BI reports (training will be available)
An ideal candidate for this position should possess the following skillsets:
- Experience in any of the following electric utility functional areas: asset strategy, system planning, substation engineering, T-line engineering, distribution engineering, system protection, substation test, system automation (RTU, SCADA etc.), compliance, operations engineering, control room operations
- Knowledge in the following: smart meter data, SCADA telemetry data, outage data, SAP Notification data, SAP asset data, SAP order data, system protection data, system automation data, GIS data, field work data
- Experience and interest in analyzing data
- Ability to document product requirements
- Interest in data analytics, data science
- Interest in building Power BI reports

title: Onsite IT Engineer
description:
As part of our hiring process, we request each applicant please complete this quick questionnaire to help us further analyze your potential fit within our company:
https://bit.ly/onsitequestionnaire
 
As a technical support/helpdesk employee, you’ll be monitoring and maintaining the computer systems and networks within an organization in a technical support role. If there are any issues or changes required, such as forgotten passwords, viruses, or email issues, you’ll be the first-person employees will come to.
Tasks can include installing and configuring computer systems, diagnosing hardware/software faults, and solving technical problems, either over the phone or face-to-face.
Most importantly, as businesses cannot afford to be without the whole system, or individual workstations, for more than the minimum time taken to repair or replace them, your technical support is vital to the ongoing operational efficiency of the company.
Some tasks you may be involved in include:
- 
Working with staff to identify computer problems and advising on the solution
- 
Working with field central engineers if the problem is more serious
- 
Installing and configuring computer hardware, software, systems, networks, printers, and scanners
- 
Monitoring and maintaining computer systems and networks
- 
Responding in a timely manner to service issues and requests
- 
Providing technical support across the company (this may be in person or over the phone)
- 
Testing and fixing faulty equipment
 
Who you ARE
- 
Creative – you find unique ways to solve difficult problems and challenge the status quo
- 
Self-managing - you take full ownership of driving tasks to completion, and helping those around you in doing the same
- 
Collaborative – you recognize that working as a team yields more effective results than working alone; do you value your workplace culture and your coworkers' experiences over chasing compensation; do you challenge others and set high goals for yourself and the people around them; do you want to spread your knowledge and insights to those around you in order to make them better.
- 
Results-driven – you focus on projects that deliver value to the end-user; do you chase the ability to cause change and disrupt industries; are you the type to find solutions to major problems
- 
Business savvy – you understand your clients and deliver solutions that cater to their needs
- 
Cross-disciplinary – you have skills that span across disciplines and are comfortable playing different roles in more than just one area
- 
Continuous learner – you seek out ways to constantly develop your skills and invest in learning every single week
- 
Agile – you pivot easily within a constantly changing environment and are comfortable with a high degree of change
- 
Risk-taker – you see failure as part of the learning process and do it time and again; are you the type to not hold back on whenever you have an idea; are you not scared to try something new, and will do your best in collecting data and analytics to make sure that your ideas are foolproof
Who you are NOT
- 
Individual contributor – you wait for directives from management and work individually to accomplish goals
- 
Specialist - you specialize in a specific discipline in order to gain an ever-deeper understanding and contribute your key expertise in that area
- 
Traditional – you thrive within structured corporate organizations where roles and titles are clearly defined, and where you can climb the corporate ladder
- 
Management – you’ve established yourself as a manager within a hierarchy and are responsible for following and enforcing traditional HR practices
- 
Passive – you prefer to leave the good ideas to others and focus instead on implementing them
- 
Conservative – you stick with what has worked in the past, you are uncomfortable challenging the status quo, and generally avoid taking risks and trying new approaches
- 
Linear – you are most comfortable working in a traditional project plan/Gantt chart environment
 
Desired Skills
What operating systems, languages, processes, patterns, and practices you are aware of are not as important as your aptitude to learn and pick up new ways of doing things. You should be able to explain complex information in simple, clear terms to non-IT personnel.
 
A general curiousness and aptitude to
- 
Install/maintain servers, network, and storage devices.
- 
To pick up configuration and maintenance of generic applications.
- 
Good analytical and problem-solving skills
- 
Up-to-date technical knowledge
- 
Good interpersonal and customer care skills
- 
Strong computer skills
- 
Ability to troubleshoot and diagnose problems
- 
Ability to communicate effectively to help customers fix their issues and feel satisfied with the experience
- 
Logical thinker
 
Compensation and Benefits
- 
Competitive salary
- 
Additional employee benefits and perks
- 
Tech Stipend
- 
One-of-a-kind culture

title: System Development Engineer II, Enterprise Engineering
description:
Job Title: System Development Engineer
Position Type: Full-Time
Position Overview:
As a System Development Engineer II at our company, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing complex enterprise systems for our clients. You will work closely with our team of experienced engineers to provide innovative solutions and support our clients' overall IT strategy. This is a highly technical role that requires expertise in various technologies and the ability to think strategically and troubleshoot effectively.
Key Responsibilities:
- Collaborate with clients and internal teams to identify system requirements and objectives
- Design and implement enterprise systems that meet client needs and align with company standards and best practices
- Serve as a subject matter expert on the latest technologies and industry trends, and make recommendations for improvement and optimization
- Develop detailed technical specifications, diagrams, and documentation for system solutions
- Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues related to enterprise systems and applications
- Perform regular maintenance and updates to ensure the stability and security of systems
- Communicate project status, issues, and potential risks to stakeholders and provide recommendations for resolution
- Mentor junior engineers and share knowledge and best practices with the team
- Identify opportunities for process improvement and automation to increase efficiency and reduce costs
- Stay up-to-date on relevant technology advancements and integrate them into our systems and processes as appropriate
Qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
- Minimum of 3 years of experience in enterprise system development and implementation
- Strong knowledge of various programming languages and technologies, such as Java, C , Python, and JavaScript
- Experience with cloud platforms, such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud
- Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to troubleshoot complex technical issues
- Knowledge of networking protocols and security principles
- Strong communication and interpersonal skills to work effectively with clients and team members
- Ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
- Willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies and methodologies
- Previous experience in a leadership or mentorship role is a plus
At our company, we value diversity and are committed to equal opportunities and creating an inclusive work environment. We offer competitive salaries, comprehensive benefits, and opportunities for professional growth and development.
If you are a self-motivated and passionate engineer with a strong background in enterprise system development, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to join our dynamic and innovative team.

title: Human Resource Generalist -Exempt $50K -$55K
description:
Description:
This is a responsible position performing work in the areas of screening, interviewing and orientation of new employees, internal and external job postings, assisting with benefit administration, recruitment/retention, entering data and maintaining Human Resource information system, employee relations and services, personnel records, formalizing of policies and procedures along with the tracking of employee development and orientation. This position requires confidentiality regarding correspondence and files, self-initiative, independent thinking, motivation, out-going personality, positive public relations and a need for accuracy in work. 
EXAMPLES OF WORK DUTIES:
 (Any one position may not include all the following nor do all the listed examples include all duties and responsibilities which may be required of the position).
1. Assist HR Director with the total operation of the Human Resources office, including Payroll, EEOC compliance and Workers compensation reporting (OSHA 300 annual report).
2. Full scale recruitment including but not limited to: application screening, assessing candidates skills, interviewing, Creation of Conditional Job offers for employment, onboarding and conducting new employee orientation.
3. External Recruitment/Establishing partnerships and maintaining positive relationships with colleges, churches, Civic groups, and training institutes. This includes but not limited to, maintaining positive communication, expanding customer base, branding, meetings, presentations, research, analyze data, dispatch informational fliers/emails, transportation, and Job Fairs to increase community awareness and establish a pipeline to employment.
4. Attracting suitable candidates through online employment forums, social media, etc.
5. Processing all applications, reference checks and criminal records checks in a timely fashion for employees, volunteer, service learning students, and Encircle.
6. Maintain skills to operate the computer data base system of Human Resources Office.
7. Assist with disciplinary issues and employee/management coaching, as needed or advised. Assist company Managers on HR issues.
8. Assist with Annual Outcomes Report
9. Conduct annual Family Care Safety Registry background reports and monitoring.
10. Weekly updates/monitoring of vacancy list
11. Ability to work with a diverse work force.
12. Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills.
13. Working knowledge of current employment laws.
14. Computer proficiency.
15. Good organizational and time management skills.
16. Ability to maintain confidentiality.
17. Ability to work as a productive team player.
18. Act in a professional, courteous manner.
19. Assist with updating and revision of training curriculum.
20. Serve as an instructor for presenting new employee orientation.
21. May be required to perform additional duties not specifically listed or implied here as situations arise or as assigned by the HR Manager or Leadership personnel.
22. Assist with completion of Annual Consumer Satisfaction and employee Satisfaction Surveys.
23. Chairperson for the Recruitment Committee. Assist/Facilitate Employee Recognition and culture events. Participate in Employee Relations Committee
Requirements:
ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS: This generalist position requires a Bachelor's Degree in Human Services or 5 years of experience in the Human Resource field.
ESSENTIAL PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: This is sedentary work requiring the exertion of up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to move objects; work requires fingering, grasping, and repetitive motions; vocal communication is required for expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word; hearing is required to perceive information at normal spoken word levels; visual acuity is required for preparing and analyzing written or computer data, operation of machines, determining the accuracy and thoroughness of work, and observing general surroundings and activities; the worker is not subject to adverse environmental conditions.
Must be at least 18 years old
Must have at least a high school diploma
Mandatory drug screen 
Mandatory criminal background checks

title: Market Analyst
description:
Why CCI? 
CCI Systems, Inc. is an Employee-Owned solution provider specializing in telecommunications, comprehensive network assessments, industry-leading engineering, drafting and design services, and 24/7 support services. Come join our team of engineers and experts that guide our customers toward the right choices to future-proof their network for years to come. Our outstanding team-based work culture and environment has allowed us to grow, develop, and retain long-term employees. We value our employee’s hard work and determination and 
REWARD
 results all while having fun! 
Our mission
 is to make life better by connecting people through innovative communication systems.
We are seeking 
a
 
Market Analyst
 to lead market research efforts, prepare market analysis material, follow, and monitor industry trends, and provide actionable market data/information to the necessary stakeholders. The market analyst will also create content for CCI’s website and for industry events on an as needed basis. 
Responsibilities
- Develop and maintain deep understanding of telecom and broadband industry – trends, funding sources, timelines, RFPs, associated locations, etc.
- In the future, there are plans to expand and develop knowledge base to encompass parallel industries, including but not limited to electric/power and others, as the need arises.
- Lead market research, prepare material and relay actionable market data/information to the necessary stakeholders regularly.
- Document federal and state government funding programs such as RDOF and BEAD including amounts, timing, and recipients as well as other key updates and strategies associated.
- Document evaluation of pricing models, forecast demand for new and existing services, and help identify areas of potential growth.
- Document evaluation of potential demand for new and future service offerings.
- Document evaluation of competitive landscape including mergers, acquisitions, investments, new entrants, large project announcements, major leadership changes, etc.
- Document evaluation of what customers value and consumption models.
- Document evaluation of demographics and create target consumer profiles.
- Assist with the creation and implementation of process development and improvement plans as it relates to data mining, analysis, and creating actionable data.
- Prepare market data reports utilizing data from a variety of internal and external resources.
- Provide actionable data to the necessary stakeholders and assist in managing timelines and process to turn this data into opportunities for CCI Systems.
- Join RFP sites and mine for relevant opportunities.
- Participate in focus groups, meetings, and agendas as it relates to the position. 
- Ensure confidentiality of company and customer information.
- Assist in the research and development for marketing related tasks as necessary.
- Other duties as assigned by manager.
 
Qualifications
- Bachelor’s degree in market analysis or closely related field.
- 2+ years of experience with market data analysis is required.
- 3+ years of experience with market data analysis within telecommunications and/or similar industries is preferred.
- Excellent computer skills, including proficiency in all Microsoft Office products.
- Familiar with tools such as Google Alerts, HubSpot, ZoomInfo, 6Sense, DemandBase, Euromonitor, Gartner, Factiva, Pitchbook, CapIQ, Refinitiv Workspace, Kompyte, Crayon, FactSet, Brandwatch, Ariba Discovery, GovWin, BidSync, Public RFP, BoardDocs, BroadbandUSA, RFP Central, Adobe Acrobat, Zoom, and other similar software.
- Understanding of request for proposal (RFP) websites, social media networks, and blog platforms is preferred.
- Demonstrate a genuine passion for your work, maintain a positive outlook, and exhibit self-motivation and drive in your endeavors.
- Demonstrate the capability to proactively seek and uncover elusive data, including identifying potential decision-makers through effective research.
- Possess a strong analytical mindset with the capability to review and comprehend research data effectively.
- Proficient in problem-solving and critical thinking, with the ability to analyze situations, evaluate information, and devise effective solutions.
- Demonstrates the ability to meet deadlines and/or targets, thriving in high-pressure or stressful situations.
- Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills - ability to actively listen and clearly communicate.
- Possesses strong organizational skills encompassing scheduling, planning, process review, and the meticulous documentation of detailed notes and reports.
- Ability to work independently, collaborate with team, and maintain professional demeanor.
- The ability to embrace corporate values, understands the company mission, and exemplifies CCI behaviors.
Shift 
is
 
full-time, Monday-Friday between the hours of 8:00 am – 5:00 pm CST. Must be flexible and willing to work outside normal business hours as necessary.

title: Service Delivery Coordinator
description:
Description:
Individuals in this role work closely with the sales team and the sales engineer(s), as well as Network Operations, to ensure that the customer’s expectations towards actualization of services are met.
Duties and responsibilities fall into the 4 main categories of Customer Facing; System Interaction and Order Management; Vendor Management; and Accountability.
Customer Facing 
- Single Point of Contact – Manages, plans and directs the overall order and service related activities for the company’s customer service function to ensure all expectations and intervals are met. 
- Sets the customers’ expectations and establishes timelines in regards to milestones and installation of services. 
- Handles all customer questions, concerns and escalations. 
- Provides Firm Order Commitments on each order for customer to manage our interval progress. Owns relationship building with the customer. 
- Works with customers to meet Service Level Agreements (SLAs). 
System Interaction - Order Management 
- Implementation of the appropriate provisioning plans. 
- Information management & document issuance – including Data Integrity. 
- Establishes and maintains expectations/deadlines. 
- Ensures proper MRC and NRC are billing at circuit activation. 
- Maintains and updates documentation for standardization. 
- Manages internal resources (tangible and intangible) to meet deadlines.
Vendor Management 
- Manages escalations against vendors when dates are slipped or are in jeopardy. 
- Coordinates vendor meets and testing activities. 
- Tracks orders and provide status to staff and outside vendors/carriers. 
- Manages data integrity functions with regards to vendor information.
Accountability 
- Meeting Commitments - Responsible for on time deliverables and meeting the FOC. 
- Professional Relationships - Managing vendor and customer relationships. 
- Project Management - Keeping all timelines on track, managing internal and external projects.

- Proven ability to work in a fast paced, time critical environment.
- Ability to interpret information.
- Excellent attention to detail.
